title: An Old church in a small town....fabulous...!
review: It is an old church but it was closed when we visited. The exterior is quite a reminder of British era. Not a very important place to visit so if you have time you can go....

title: Quite and by the hills
review: This church is located in Lansdowne on Mall road. The church is surrounded by lush green forests on mountains on all sides which adds to the beauty of this place. Make sure you visit it if you are in Lansdowne.

title: A simple Church that played melodious Hindi Hymns
review: This simple Church has an austere entrance that is laid with pebbles, one must remove footwear before entering it. Inside, the walls are simple with melodious Hindi Hymns that play.

title: On our way to tip n top
review: This is a small  nice old church . Plays hymns inside. Its located on mall rd. The nature around the church is worth the stop.

title: Good Place
review: the place is around a km from market.  its better to visit walking to enjoy the surroundings and the church as such.

title: A small church with a history
review: After the British left India, there was no priest who could conduct prayers in the church of this small hill station of Lansdowne. It served different other purposes for more than 30 years till it was restored in early eighties. The church of Agra started supporting it and now regular masses are held.

title: An old church at a good location
review: Old Church which is now operational for the last thirty years is a quiet place on the Mall Road. Regular service is conducted every day . It is one of the attraction in Landsdowne .

title: Small Sweet church or Chapel?
review: its a very small church... you can just take a click on the way and carry on..not worthy enough to get out of your car and spend time..

title: Historic point !
review: Near the tiffany hill top point. When i visited it was close , so one can get a picture clicked from outside and do the check list. Normal church like any other , just spend a few minutes !

title: A cute small Church
review: It was a custe small church on the bank of a turn on Mall Road. Not much of parking place around. The door was locked so could explore the outside only.

title: A simple church
review: Its a simple church and not as such an attraction. The only  thing  is  that  the  surroundings are quite good.

title: Beautiful Church
review: The palace is extremely beautiful and peaceful. Cool breeze during your visit to this place will add cheery on the cake.

title: Peaceful .. calm and serene
review: The moment you enter St. John's church, you feel a feeling of calmness and spend five minutes in the church sitting in silence, and feel the energy.

title: Small catholic church
review: Peaceful church with Indian touches. Cool and quiet spot to sit but not outstanding in terms of architecture or decoration.

title: Old Place
review: Some old places of worship have a vibe, a certain energy. This is one of them. Do visit and sit in silent contemplation for a bit as it will leave you restful and at peace.

title: Small but divine
review: We couldn’t enter the church but it looked impressive from the outside. Huge doors which gives the place an elegant look.

title: Beatiful church
review: St john church is located at a distance of 3 kilometres  from market,it is open from morni g 8 am to 5 pm .

title: A small Peaceful church
review: It is a small church but you will feel peace & calmness in it. It is clean inside and architecture is also nice. It is good for around half hour visit and to take some photos in the front of the church and inside the church.

title: A place of tranquility!
review: One of the major attraction at Lansdowne and a must visit to enjoy the architecture. A serene place where you could just spend gazing at the structure and getting the blessing of the almighty!

title: Great
review: This place has to be walked down to because of narrower roads and its closing time. A quaint church with rustic old look but very peaceful.

title: Historic and ecclesiastical
review: A Catholic church which dates back to early 1930s, St John's is a typical English style monument of British construction which has stood the difficult weathering the place would have seen in the last almost hundred years. Taken over by the syro Malabar church in early 1970s, a priest administers and offers mass regularly in the church despite thin attendance of a Hindu majority area. It was pleasing to see the extremely well maintained church and also the respect and admission shown by the tourists hardly any of whom were from the Christian community. It you spend half an hour in here you'll realize how secular the common Indian is from the manner they offer their respects to the altar.

title: Good Place to watch the hertitagesituated in the lap of nature
review: It is an ancient Church having and is good to see to relate things with the way it would have been managing 100 years ago

title: Another gorgeous piece of history
review: This is a modest, yet stunning stone church built about a 100 years ago. Extremely tranquil and holds regular prayers.

title: Do not miss if you are here on Christmas
review: We visited St, John's Church on Christmas morning at, this place will surely attract you with all the decoration and arrangements that are done on Christmas

title: Look beautiful in evening
review: We had gone here at evening. The view of this church is attractive. Outside lights is outstanding. Since the church was closed at that time, but we visit from outside and enjoyed it.

title: Nice quiet church .
review: This is a nice and quite church. Very peaceful. The entire history of the church is displayed at the entrance. Worth visiting for religious or sightseeing purposes

title: very beautiful structure.
review: Open most of the time. Very peaceful place with well documented history. Nice place to sit for sometime with good view around.

title: Serene, Calm and Perfect Hideout
review: A lot many times, I saw in movies. People travelling at random places trying to find the meaning of their lives. It was one such trip to Lansdowne and while like any other tourist, the gang was eager on seeing everything that came our way, we took a hault into this ancient building. Little did we know at that point of time it is a church. Bypassers told us. And we thought it is St. Mary's church, which is more famous among the tourist clan.

title: Church
review: A must visit if you're going to Lansdowne nice place and can spent atleast one-two hours as you will find peace there

title: Very nice interiors
review: On the way to Tip-in-Top you can come across this church. The church has very nice interiors. Prayers are being offered in here on daily basis.

title: Small archaic church
review: St. John's is a small and archaic church located in Lansdowne. Once you enter inside, you can experience the old British colonial charm. The building is quite old yet beautiful. We did not spend much time here since there was not much to do here. you are required to remove your footwear before entring the church.

title: Senere
review: St. John's Church is very serene. Prayers are held daily. Beautifully maintained, it is definitely worth a visit.

title: Nothing attractive
review: Very small place and there is nothing special and also it didn't felt like proper church (at least to me) however on ground there were small shiny stones which my kid played with a while

title: nice church
review: nice church to look for.can get great pictures and pretty good view of the surroundings from this place.

title: A nice church
review: It is a small and simple church in Lansdowne, built in 1935. It is situated at a calm and quite place with beautiful surroundings on way to Tip n Top. A good place to relax in natural environment, as it not crowded. There is another church (St Mary's Church, not visited by us) on way to Tip n Top.

title: St John's Church
review: Nice and small serene church. First place of worship of Jesus I have seen where shoes are not allowed inside.

title: Old Artistic Architectural Church
review: Old Artistic Architectural Church of British era.Good location, quiet having an old nostalgic feeling.

title: Another quaint colonial era church
review: This church is the second quaint church apart from st. mary's which is near tip-n-top (or tiffin top) point. This is atop a smallish hill and has few steps to climb. Small and pretty with a calm all across.

title: Serene, tranquil, pretty as a picture
review: The scenic beauty of the location is simply breathtaking. It was very peaceful as there were very few visitors when we went there on a Monday morning. The church and the ground is very well maintained. I could have spent hours there in the solitude surrounded by natural beauty.

title: St John but no John here
review: This is an old church where Gharwal rifle people show you movies about their regiment and this is what makes it interesting. It is no longer being used for prayers. It has stained glass windows but again nothing great about it.

title: First church
review: When we reached here no one was there around 4 pm, no body, very old church again, but very calm and quite place, one can actually sit here for a very long time

title: Beautiful Church
review: Another church in Lansdowne. Nearby and walkable. Calm and peaceful surrounding. nature lover can walk around.

title: Average visit (in case you are NOT visiting for a religious purpose)
review: Quick facts & Tips:

title: Quite Place
review: Good place for peace lovers. Very neat & clean church with beautiful house of father. Spend some time to absorb the silence. Historic design well maintained.

title: peaceful
review: nice, peaceful and well maintained. a really good visit. i enjoyed visiting the church set in peaceful surroundings

title: Old style church found it closed during afternoon
review: Old style church in the lap of nature, found it near the sight seeing spots of Lansdown. Can be covered in a long walk.

title: like any other church in any other hill station.
review: I have visited shimla, dharamshala & now lansdowne. church on mall road is common in all of them. Peaceful place.

title: I wish it was being better maintained!
review: This is a good place to see but when you see its beauty you would want that it would have been maintained in  a better manner. Its very peaceful and a lovely place. A must visit for a church goer.

title: Nice Silent Place..Lot of peace
review: Nice quiet place with lot of peace ..that too in the lap of nature..

title: A Small church
review: We were lucky to find this church open. There was no rush, quite and peaceful. You will not find anybody from staff also. So the best place to be in peace and chat with god.

title: Good place to relax
review: A very quite place. Sit there and you can get a lot of peace and calmness. Lansdowne is scarcely populated so this place was not attracting a lot of tourist. I find this place good only if one is looking to get some relax.

title: Nice Place To Be In
review: Its a very calm and peaceful church.If you are someone religious or want to spend time with yourself in Lansdowne then this is the place.Though nothing much to see for sightseeing lovers(1hr would be more than enough) but if you just want to sit/pray/want sometime alone in peace and tranquility then you should visit this church.It is one of the two main churches in Lansdowne.

title: Serene
review: It is one of the 2 church in Lansdowne and not be missed place. It is reachable by road and is on the way to Tip and Top point.

title: average
review: not much to do. its a simple church, we visited on christmas still not much decorated or crowd there. was totally empty inside.

title: Beauiful, rustic, charming
review: 1st church on the way to Tip n Top point, approx 1km from St Mary's Church.

title: Heaven on earth
review: Felt close to god while visiting this beautiful church from the British Raj days. Extremely peaceful surroundings with a very well maintained interior

title: Also to see...
review: A small church with well maintained souvenir for last 100 odd years. Worth a visit on you way back from tip n top.

title: Nice view.!
review: Seriously, you don't need a cab or anything in Lansdowne. Just trek along the road and you will find hidden gems there. Like this one.

title: The spiritual high
review: One of the 'neatest' churches you will ever find in any hill station - quaint, yet very well preserved and quite spacious too to take both a break as well as indulge in some inspiring photography!!

title: Olden.. Historical.. Nothing more special
review: Lansdowne as such does not have anything called an attraction. So amidst that, this place is good to visit as it is an olden church and it is known for its history. Otherwise, its nothing great. a small peaceful church.

title: Nice church
review: A small and nice church in a quiet place...nothing special though...can be skipped in case time crunch....

title: Serenity at Par
review: Amazing serene location of church. Loved the peace and harmony around with breezing chilly winds. The pathway along that takes you to Tip and Top point is also wonderful experience. Dont forget to stay at treehouses. Happy Short Journey it ll be, Enjoy :) You can also take the adventurous route of jungle from behind this church :)

title: Beauty of the City
review: Its a oldest church in the town, made by British in the early of 18th century, its a historical monument in the town.

title: calm Place
review: The Place is very Calm. old Furniture and Building. Was feeling good and relaxed inside the church. Nice place to sit for few Hours.

title: old church
review: this is an old church which reminds of the british era. it is a heritage well preserved. peaceful place.

title: Small and beautiful church
review: Small and beautiful church. On the way to Tip and Top. go there walking and enjoying the trek and the Nature. Clean place.

title: A beauty from the past
review: A beautiful church giving a good view and understanding of the old architecture

title: St. John's church.
review: The second Church in Landsdowne, built around 1936 or so dedicated to St. John, the Baptist. The church had been given up by the Agra Diocese after the British left. It was used as a store, a school and even a stable before it was rightfully given back by the Govt to be used as a church again. Seems to be more active than the St. Mary's church.

title: Fantastic
review: Peace & Tranquility, This is situated in natural surrounding of Uttarakhand Hills and the feelgs on reachinfg there are better experience than described.

title: was ok
review: Went for a visit.. also some movie was going on in the church regarding the garwal rifles and their restoration of landsdowne from british and their gallour and vallont.

title: Small quaint church
review: This is a small Catholic church a little distance outside the village. Its around 90 years old and is a good example of colonial architecture. While coming from the village, it will come on your right. There are a few steps that you need to take to come upto the entrance. There is a statue of Madonna near the stairs. The way from the statue to the church is paved with little stones. There are flowers on both sides. The interior of the church is pretty ordinary. It has had a varied history though, it was used as a godown and a stable.

title: Good to spend some time on the way
review: Pretty much like other churches. Can be seen while going towards tip-in-top point. The structure is not very grand but looks good.

title: well maintained church
review: this church an old one with a rich history has been looked after well...nice and quiet place being a place of pride for the small town of Lansdowne..

title: Pretty & quiet
review: This is a prettier church than the St. Mary’s Church. It looks better maintained too. It is right at a turning; so you may have some problem figuring out where to park. It has its story written on a board outside. It was quiet and we could not see anyone here. But its beauty was partly in the silence surrounding it, as well as in the colonial building. Do take a look.

title: Another heritage
review: Another beautiful peaceful place in the lap of mother nature. Just be there for some time. Enjoy the old heritage building. Take pics onthe slopes around the place.

title: Nice Church in the middle of Greenery
review: Surrounded by a  lot of greenery this church is a nice little stop for tourist. Small little church. One can visit during the day.

title: Nice
review: This is one of the oldest museum at lansdowne. However, do check for the timings it opens for only 1-2 hours in a day in the morning.

title: Nice Church..
review: It is an 100 yrs old church........Nice church in a quite place.......Nothing special though........

title: Serene
review: St John's church is a beautiful old church on way to tip n top.Though the facade is old the serene surroundings create a very peaceful atmosphere.

title: St. John church is very calm & quite place.
review: St. John church is very calm & quite place to visit. I recommend all visiting people to Lansdowne to visit this church.

title: Can be visited
review: This is on the way to St.Mary Church and top-and-top. It is a small and well kept church and can be given a short visit.

title: A place of God
review: Really a place where you can Feel & see the God.

title: Very old church
review: The church is older than a century.  Very well maintained.  One of the example of how rich the construction used to be in the old days.

title: Absolute peace and serenity.
review: I felt as if I was in heaven even if it was just for a moment. I felt my heart becoming warm and my eyes wet when I saw crucified Jesus there. If only I could go there everyday and pray.

title: Very scenic
review: remminds u of british time, the greenry there, trails, architecture just makes u fall in love with the place. U just want to sit there and soak the beauty of the place

title: Peace!!!
review: Its a small, old Church, built in 1937. Spend some time and you can feel the peace inside.

title: nice old church
review: what we likes the most was the old building beautifully maintained. the view outside is amazing and the one thing i say about this place is full of peace.

title: A place to visit in the morning
review: This place we had visited during our morning walk and felt in love with this. Very quiet and calm place for worship.

title: stop to watch the Garhwal  Rifles video
review: The 20 minute movie gives you lot of details about Garhwal Rifles.  Lansdowne is the Regimental center of Garhwal Rifles.

title: St. John's Church, Lansdowne
review: Located on the walking trail from Regimental Centre to Tip-in-Top, St. John's Church adds to the charm and tranquility of the surrounding. A few footsteps from the meandering road and you are standing in front of this simple yet beautiful Church.

title: St. John's Church
review: It is located at the Mall Road, a Roman Catholic Church. Established in 1936.  This wonderful church has been neglected and disused after independence, and was eventually handed over to the Government of India in 1951.
